Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: How's the book?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: It'll be out later this year.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'll look for it.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: I'll send you a copy.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: God, I loved it. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Bitch went down. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Sid--SuperBitch!

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I thought you might want some ice for that right hook.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I'll be right next door. Try to get some sleep.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Any word on my Dad?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Not yet, but we're looking. If you need anything...

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, yeah...

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Just another sleepover at the Riley's.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Just like old times, ain't it?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No, nothing's like it used to be.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Do you really think Billy did it?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He was there, Tatum.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: I knew this guy was too perfect. He was destined to have a flaw.

Speaker: mama riley
Dialogue: Telephone, dear.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: mama riley
Dialogue: It's for Sid

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: My Dad?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Take a message.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: It's alright. I'll get it.

Speaker: mama riley
Dialogue: How is she?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hello Sidney.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: NOOOOOO...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Poor Billy-boyfriend. An innocent guy doesn't stand a chance with you.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: LEAVEMEALONE!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Looks like you fingered the wrong guy...again.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Hang up, Sid.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Don't worry. You'll find out soon enough. I promise.

Speaker: mama riley
Dialogue: Dewey! Dewey!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: This is gonna be fun, Sidney. Just like old times.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: What? What?

Speaker: mama riley
Dialogue: I think you girls really should stay home today.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Your objection is duly noted.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'd rather be around a lot of people, Mama Riley.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: ..who escaped a vicious attack last night was the daughter of Maureen Prescott who was brutally killed last year when convicted murderer Cotton Weary...

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: ..broke into their home and savagely raped and tortured the deceased. Cotton Weary is currently awaiting appeal for the death sentence handed down after the young Sidney testified against him. She was the key witness in the state's prosecution...

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: It's never gonna stop. Is it?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Billy was released. His cellular bill was clean. He didn't make those calls.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Somebody called me, Dewey. I'm not making it up.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I know. We're checking every cellular account in the county. Any calls made to you or Casey Becker are being cross- referenced. It's gonna take time but we'll find him.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And my Dad? Any word on him?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Hey, it's school. You'll be safe here.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: How does it feel to almost be brutally murdered?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Leave the girl alone, will ya? She wants to go to school.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Come on, Sid.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Just a sec...I need to talk to someone.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Stop right there.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'm not here to fight.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Just stay back.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I want to talk to you.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Kenny. Camera. Now.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Off the record. No cameras.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Please. You owe me.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: I owe you shit.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You owe my mother.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Your mother's murder was last year's hottest court case. Somebody was gonna write a book about it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And it had to be you with all your lies and bullshit theories.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: What is your problem? You got what you wanted. Cotton Weary is in jail. They're gonna gas him. A book is not gonna change that.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Do you still think he's innocent?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: He was convicted in a court of law. Your testimony put him away. It doesn't matter what I think.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: During the trial, you did all those stories about me. You called me a liar.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: I think you falsely identified him. Yes.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Have you talked to Cotton?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Many times.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Has his story changed?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Not one word. He admits to having sex with your mother but that's all.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He's lying. She wouldn't have touched him. He raped her, then butchered her. Her blood was all over his coat.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: He was drunk that night. He left his coat at your house, after your mother seduced him...

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I saw him leaving wearing it.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: But couldn't it have been someone else you saw wearing that coat? The same person who planted it in Cotton's car, framing him? The same person who really killed your mother?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No, Cotton murdered my mother.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: You're not so sure anymore, are you?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No, it was Cotton.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Nice welt.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: The killer is still on the loose, isn't he? These murders are related.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Yo--let's rock.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'm sorry I mangled your face.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Wait, Sidney, don't go...

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Jesus Christ! An innocent man on death row. A killer still on the loose. Kenny, tell me I'm dreaming.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You want to go live?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: No, not so fast. We have nothing concrete.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: When did that ever stop you? You can't sit on this. This is huge.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: If I'm gonna blow this up-I need hard proof.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: But it's so much easier when we make it up.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Not this time. I owe Cotton that much. Hell, even I thought that man was guilty.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Just relax. You're at school now. No one can get you here.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: But if it wasn't Billy it could be anybody. He could be here at school right now.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Serial killers are smart by definition. They minimize their risk. They plan and pre-calculate everything. Showing up here would be the most lame-brain move he could make.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He promised me he'd be back.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: I wouldn't put too much stock in a psycho's promise.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: This morning several students, in what appears to be a prank, have been spotted wearing masks. School officials have yet to comment but this is the same type of mask worn by the killer...

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: This is a mistake. I shouldn't be here.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: I want you to meet me here right after class, okay?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Shit, what is he doing here?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I bet he's pissed.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Just ignore him. You had good reason to think what you did.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Hi, Sid. Can we talk a sec?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: You know if I were accused of carving up two people, I'd take the opportunity to skip school.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hey, go easy, Tatum. He didn't do it.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Talk to me, Sid.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Why are they doing this?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Are you kidding? This is like Christmas.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Owwww...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: You open your mouth and stupidity pours out.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Stay away from her, Billy.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Jesus, SHIT!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Hey, hey, it's just me.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What? You don't still think it's me?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No...I don't...it's just...Oh God, Billy, someone was there, someone tried to kill me.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: The police say I scared him off. It wasn't me, Sid.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I know. He called again last night at Tatum's house.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: See, it couldn't have been me. I was in jail, remember?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'm so sorry...please understand.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Understand what? That I got a girlfriend who would rather accuse me of being a psychopathic killer than touch me.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You know that's not true.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Then what is it? Is there somebody else?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Is it the sex thing? Am I being too pushy?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No, it's me, Billy. I need time. I'm still adjusting to my mom.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It's been a year since she died.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Tomorrow. One year tomorrow.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: When are you gonna let that go, Sid? When my mom left my dad--I just accepted it. This is the way it is. She's not coming back.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Your parents split up. It's not the same thing. Your mom left town, she's not in a coffin somewhere.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: You have to move on, Sid.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I'm glad to know you're coping so well with life, Billy. But some of us aren't so perfect. Some of us are just trying to hold on.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Pathetic.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Siddneey...

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Is someone there?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It's me, Sidney.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He's here...I saw him...he's here...

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: She's okay. Looks like some boys were teasing her. Himbry's shutting down the school though. I want you to take look around.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Yes, sir, sheriff.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Hi! Gale Weathers. Field Correspondent, INSIDE STORY.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I know who you are, ma'am. How's the eye?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Productive. So they're closing down the school?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Well..uh...yes ma'am. For the time being.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: And why is that? Has something happened?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: You're not supposed to be here, ma'am.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: I know, I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker but who knew? Please, call me Gale. You look awfully young to be a police officer.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I'm twenty-five years old, ma'am.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Twenty-five, huh? In a demographic study I proved to be most popular amongst males, 11-24. I just missed you. Of course, you don't look a day over twelve, except in the upper torso area. Does the force require that you work out?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: No, ma'am. Because of my boyish good looks, muscle mass has increased my acceptance as a serious police officer.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Boy, you people sure do make fuss over a serial killer.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Serial killer is not really accurate, ma'am. The killer has yet to strike twice.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Well, we can hope, can't we? We certainly don't have any leads. A ghost mask, a cellular phone--not much there.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: We're tracking the cellular phone bill.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Really? You small town guys are good. And have you located Sidney's father?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: No, not yet.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: He's not a suspect, is he?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: We haven't ruled out that possibil...

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: If you'll excuse me, ma'am.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Am I keeping you? I'm sorry.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: That's quite alright. If I may say so, ma'am, you're much prettier in person.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: So you do watch the show?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I just turned 25. I was 24 for a whole year.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: You are precious. Please, call me Gale.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: It was just some sick fuck having a laugh.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: It was him, Tatum. I know it.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: You are not to be alone again. Is that clear? If you pee--I pee.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Is this not cool or what? Hey, Sid, what happened?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: For once, Stu, drop it.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Okay, but whatever you did--the entire student body thanks you.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: And to celebrate this impromptu fall break, I propose we have a party. Tonight, my house.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Are you serious?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: My parents are out of town. It'll be like my hurricane bash last year. Nothing extreme. Just a few of us, hangin'.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: This could be good. What do you think, Sid?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Come on. Pathos has it's perks.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Remember, there's safety in numbers.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Yeah, okay...whatever.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Cool. See you guys tonight. Bring food.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Maybe Cotton Weary is telling the truth. Maybe he was having an affair with your mom.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: So you think my mom was a slut too?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: I didn't say that, Sid. But you know there were rumors. Your dad was always out of town on business. Maybe your mom was a very unhappy woman.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: If they were having an affair how come that Cotton couldn't prove it in court?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: You can't prove a rumor. That's why it's a rumor.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Created by that little tabloid twit Gale Weathers.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: It goes further back, Sid. There's been talk about other men.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And you believe it?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Well...you can only hear that Richard Gere-gerbil story so many times before you have to start believing it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: If I was wrong Cotton, then he's still out there.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Don't go there, Sid. You're starting to sound like some Wes Carpenter flick. Don't freak yourself out--we've got a long night ahead of us.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You're right. I'm cracking up. Ignore me.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Come on, let's rock.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: How'd you do?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Piece of cake. She'll be there.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Thanks, butt wart. You did good.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: So you gonna try and make up with Sid?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Duh...that's quick.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I was just asking. Why are you always at me?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Because I'm trying to build your self- esteem. You're far too sensitive.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: You ready to party hard tonight?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You know it.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Jesus, this place is packed.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: We had a run in the mass murder section.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You coming tonight?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm off early--curfew you know.  Now that's poor taste.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: If you were the only suspect in a senseless bloodbath would you be standing in the horror section?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: It was all a misunderstanding. He didn't do anything.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: You're such a little lap dog. He's got killer printed all over his forehead.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: The why'd the police let him go?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Because, obviously they don't watch enough movies. This is standard horror movie stuff. PROM NIGHT revisited.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Why would he want to kill his own girlfriend?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: There's always some stupid bullshit reason to kill your girlfriend. That's the beauty of it all. Simplicity. Besides, if it's too complicated you lose your target audience.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: So what's his reason?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Maybe Sidney wouldn't have sex with him.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: She's saving herself for you.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Could be. Now that Billy's tried to mutilate her, you think Sid would go out with me?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I think her father did it. How come they can't find his ass?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Because he's probably dead. His body will come popping out in the last reel somewhere...eyes gauged. See, the police are always off track with this shit, if they'd watch PROM NIGHT they'd save time. There's formula to it. A very simple one. Everyone's always a suspect--the father, the principal, the town derelict...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Which is you...

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: So while they're off investigating a dead end, Billy, who's been written off as a suspect, is busy planning his next hunting expedition.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: How do we know you're not the killer?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: Uh...hi, Billy.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Maybe your movie-freaked mind lost it's reality button?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: You're absolutely right. I'm the first to admit it. If this were a scary movie, I'd be the prime suspect.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: And what would be your motive?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: It's 1995--motives are incidental.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: A party? Mom's gonna kill you. Then me.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Don't be so self-righteous. It's just a little blow out--we'll be perfectly safe.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: God, look at this place, it's THE TOWN THAT DREADED SUNDOWN.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Hey, I saw that movie. True story, 'bout some killer in Texas.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Hey, Sid. Just think if they make a movie about you. Who's gonna play you?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Oh, god...

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I see you as a young Meg Ryan myself.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Thanks, Dewey. But with my luck they'd cast Tori Spelling.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: I'll just be a few minutes. Don't go far.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Is Billy going to be there tonight?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: He better not be. I told Stu to keep his mouth shut. I think we can live without EVERYBODY'S ALL AMERICAN for one night.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Two minutes tops.

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: Dewey! Where the hell you been, boy?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Keeping my eye on Sidney.

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: Listen up, Dewey, because it's bad. Real bad. Aircomp just faxed us. The calls were listed to Neil Prescott--Sidney's father. He made the calls with his cellular phone. It's confirmed.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Couldn't his cellular number have been cloned?

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: There's more. Guess what tomorrow is? The anniversary of his wife's death. It all fits. He's our man.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Have you contacted the bureau?

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: They believe he's out of state by now. We'll keep roadblocks and curfew in effect through the night. If he's not picked up by morning--we'll do a house to house.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: You think he could still be in town?

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: He'd have to be crazy. Where's Sidney?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: She's with my sister. Should I bring her in?

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: Hold off for now. Just stay close to her.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: She'll be with her friends over at Stu Maker's tonight.

Speaker: sheriff burke
Dialogue: Watch her. Don't let on--just keep your eyes out.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Billy's right. Whenever he touches me, I just can't relax.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: You have a few intimacy issues as a result of your mother's untimely death. It's no big deal. You'll thaw out.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: But he's been so patient with me, Tatum. You know, with all the sex stuff. How many guys would put up with a girlfriend who's sexually anorexic?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Billy and his penis don't deserve you.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What do you think about when you're having sex?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: With Stu, there's little time to stop and reflect. But sometimes before, to relax and get in the mood, I think about Grant Goodeve.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Grant Goodeve--the oldest brother on EIGHT IS ENOUGH. Remember that show? He was the one who lived off alone. He would come around every now and then with his guitar and sing "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." He had all these brain dead sisters and that idiot brother from CHARLES IN CHARGE. God, I was in love with Grant, he was so hot. The show came on every day after school right during my puberty years. Grant Goodeve was very instrumental in my maturing as a woman.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: How does that get you in the mood with Stu?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: During foreplay, I sing the theme song to myself. "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." It's a real turn on.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No way.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Grant wrote the song himself. I'm convinced the lyrics had a secret meaning, "Eight is enough..."

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What secret meaning? Like a Satanical thing?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Watch the show, Sid. His basket is bigger than the one you're pushing.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: TATUM!

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Oh, Sidney. WHAT? A guy can talk tits til he's dead but the minute you mention an eight inch weenie. Watch out.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: There's that sense of humor. I knew it still existed. Ohh, Sid, let's have some fun tonight.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Deal.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: You girls ready.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Looks like I'm your personal bodyguard tonight, Sid.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: No, Dewey. You'll ruin the whole night.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Sorry, police orders. I'll stay out of the way, I promise.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Caterer's here.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: That's mature.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Where you guys been? We had to start without you.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: What's the plan?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Prep the compact, we'll hide it in a window and tape all of tonight's festivities.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: The control board's glitched. You know we can't carry a live picture.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: What's the delay?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: About thirty seconds.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: As long as it records I don't give a shit. We're not doing a remote.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Evening, ma'am.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Deputy...good evening.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: What brings you out to these parts?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: You never know when or where a story will break.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Not much story here. Just a bunch of kids cutting loose.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Then what are you doing here?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Keeping an eye on things. Checking the place out.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Mind if I join you?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Not at all.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: I thought we'd make it a BLOCKBUSTER night.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I thought everything was checked out.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: I had 'em hid in the foreign section.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: THE FOG, TERROR TRAIN, PROM NIGHT --How come Jamie Lee Curtis is in all these movies?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: She's the Scream Queen.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: With that set of lungs--she should be.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Tits--see.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: How many EVIL DEAD'S?  How many HELLRAISER'S?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I got it. Tatum get me a beer. They're in the fridge in the garage.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: What am I? The beer wench?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hey, guess who's here? It's that chick from INSIDE STORY?

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: Shit, Dewey!

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: What is she doing here?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: She's with me. I just wanted to check on things.

Speaker: tatum
Dialogue: So you did--now leave...and take your media muff with you.

Speaker: some teen
Dialogue: I watch your show regularly.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: This must be big news to be on INSIDE STORY.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Huge.

Speaker: another teen
Dialogue: Wanna interview us?

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: We could be like two grief stricken students and we'll say really nice things about our good friends who were slaughtered senselessly.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I can cry on cue.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Maybe later?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Can I trouble you for some water?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: How 'bout a beer? Randy--get the lady a beer.

Speaker: randy
Dialogue: You get it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Have they found my father?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Afraid not.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Should I be worried?

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: Not yet.
